instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message: Hi. I have here  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a board after water damaged on keyboard. i removed board and check under microscope but i can't see any water damaged on it (checked 3 times). Laptop no powering up when i connect charger. Somebody told me that board need to be connected to good battery is that true? Don't have board view to check voltage on board. Anybody had this problem b4?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message: Needs a REAL 85W charger also to power up. I believe it powers up without battery but will have shut down issues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message: am using bench power supply and is no working. also i opened brand new original charger 85w but no powering up at all. its strange because is not any liquid on main board. difficult for me to fix it if i dont have board view for it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message: is any similar board view from different board i can use?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message:
Green and the orange light ok? PPBUS voltage?
Is this on ORIGNAL Apple 85W magsafe 2 charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message: when i connect original charger 85w green light coming up then orange after so is charging. i have 12v and 3.4v on battery connector pins so charging is ok

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message: Got 3V on L7560? Orange light does not mean it is charging, it will turn orange without a battery too. What is PPBUS without battery connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message: is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is close to  <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board ? i have schematic and board view for that one

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> present? Exact voltage on PPBUS without battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message: how can i check  <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> is i dont have board view for this board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message: Use 3787 board view and brain power, there is no easy way with these board. It could still be a bad battery, not 100% sure these need a working battery. I have no machine to verify this on right now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message: am sorry for be we bit not professional here. am learning only 1 year. am fixing plenty macbooks but sometimes i have some problems. am using board view from 3787 but  when i search for <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> testing points on main board is not this same what is on 00138 so is difficult to tall.  also battery is dead because when i plugged in its showing me charging . i have 12v and 3.4v on battery connector . i charger it for wee while then disconnect charger and check for voltage it was very low so battery is gone to

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message:
ok. voltage checked :
L7095 : 3.427
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> : 3.345v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> : 0.001v   ?
 so i think we are getting close

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a liquid damaged no power up
threads.message: Well S4 not being present is the worst thing to diagnose and does not get us anywhere. I need to know if <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> is high and you need to test the board with a charged battery.

threads.message:

still waiting for battery us well
